description:
The Zero Dig initiative, based in Stroud, is a non-profit organization focused on sustainable agriculture through a method known as "zero dig" or "no dig." This approach emphasizes minimal disturbance to the soil, preserving the mycelium network and promoting biodiversity, which enhances nutrient density in crops. Founded by philanthropist Mario, who sought to utilize his wealth meaningfully post-COVID, the initiative aims to produce high-quality food locally while fostering community engagement and job creation.

The organization operates on a model that combines scientific research with entrepreneurial strategies, allowing it to explore commercial partnerships and expand its reach. Zero Dig has established relationships with local eateries and has begun to attract attention from larger entities, including potential collaborations with supermarkets and housing developments. The initiative is also focused on educating the community about the benefits of nutrient-dense food and sustainable farming practices.
name: Zero Dig
